required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DSAEK/DMEK and Cystoid Macular Edema - the Role for Topical NSAIDs (Nepafenac) (DMEC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Clinical Two-arm Trial Comparing Inflammation and Cystoid Macular Edema for the Medication Regimens Postoperative Topical NSAIDs and Steroids to Only Postoperative Topical Steroids in Patients Undergoing Corneal Endothelial Transplantations (DMEC)

brief_summary.textblock: The DMEC trial is a randomized clinical two-arm trial comparing inflammation and cystoid macular edema for the medication regimens postoperative topical NSAIDs and steroids to only postoperative topical steroids in patients undergoing corneal endothelial transplantations (DSAEK or DMEK).

primary_outcome.description: Measure central macular thickness (in um) on optical coherence tomography (OCT)
Determine if the patient has CME based on evaluation of macular cysts on optical coherence tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively, and 1 week, 4 weeks, 2 months and 2 years after surgery
Preoperatively, and 1 day, 1 week, 4 weeks, 2 months and 2 years after surgery
Preoperatively, and 1 week, 4 weeks, 2 months and 2 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measure uncorrected and corrected distance visual acuity using visual acuity chart

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week, 4 weeks, 2 months and 2 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measure corneal endothelial cell density using microscopy instrument

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week, 4 weeks and 2 months after surgery
Preoperatively, and 1 week, 2 months, and 2 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measure CMT (in um) on optical coherence tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively, and 1 week, 2 months, and 2 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if the patient has CME based on evaluation of macular cysts on optical coherence tomography (OCT)

arm_group.description: Topical dexamethasone 1 mg/ml (Spersadex) started the day after surgery
Topical nepafenac (Nevanac) 3 mg/ml and dexamethasone 1 mg/ml (Spersadex) started the day after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must be 18 years and older at the time of the signing of the informed consent. There is no upper age limit.
- Scheduled for DSAEK or DMEK
- Ability to cooperate fairly well during the examinations
- Willing to participate in the study and capable of giving informed consent, which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions in the informed consent form (ICF) and in this protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications for use of any medication (as listed in the approved SPC, e.g. allergy, pregnancy, breastfeeding)
- Pregnancy or possible pregnancy during the study period
- Preoperative macular edema and/or ongoing treatment for macular edema
- Re-transplantation
- In-operated glaucoma shunt / valve (e.g. Ahmed glaucoma valve)
- Aphakic eyes (eyes without a biological or artificial intraocular lens)
- Loss of central vision (expected visual acuity potential after surgery below 0.1 Snellen)

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Ophthalmology, Oslo University Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal investigator, Senior consultant MD PhD
